meanings.definition: Make (someone or something) accept (something) as normal or usual.
meanings.sent1: She accustoms her dog to wearing a leash.
meanings.sent2: He accustoms himself to waking up early for work.
meanings.sent3: The cat accustoms itself to the sound of the vacuum cleaner by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The new student quickly accustoms to the rhythm of the school bell.
meanings.sent5: The warm weather accustoms the plants to thriving in the garden.

meanings.sent1: After a while, she accustoms to the noise of the city.
meanings.sent2: He accustoms to the taste of spicy food after trying it a few times.
meanings.sent3: The puppy accustoms to chasing its tail in circles for entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The traveler accustoms to the feeling of being constantly on the move.
meanings.sent5: The child accustoms to the routine of bedtime stories before sleep.
